meanings.definition: To make smaller or reduce in size.
meanings.sent1: She dumbsized her wardrobe by donating old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company dumbsized its workforce to save money.
meanings.sent3: He dumbsized his collection of toys to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent4: The chef dumbsized the portions to reduce food waste.
meanings.sent5: The suitcase was dumbsized to fit in the overhead compartment.

meanings.definition: To simplify or make less complex.
meanings.sent1: The teacher dumbsized the math problem for the students to understand.
meanings.sent2: She dumbsized the recipe so it was easier to follow.
meanings.sent3: The manual was dumbsized to make it less confusing for users.
meanings.sent4: He dumbsized the instructions to make them more user-friendly.
meanings.sent5: The presentation was dumbsized to focus on the key points.

meanings.definition: To decrease in importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: The new policy dumbsized the role of middle management.
meanings.sent2: She dumbsized the issue by addressing it later.
meanings.sent3: His apology dumbsized the impact of his mistake.
meanings.sent4: The error dumbsized the credibility of the report.
meanings.sent5: The delay dumbsized the excitement of the event.
